title: When You Sit To Write: Poems of support and inspiration for writers
features: When You Sit To Write addresses every aspect of the writing process—title, voice, content, courage, consciousness, playfulness, inspiration, joy, muses, revising, patience, competition, submissions, rejections, frustration, blocks, excuses, and more. This engaging collection of poems spans the range of emotions evoked by writing and will support and inspire those who face the blank page. Writers of all kinds will find common ground here.
description: Lynn Robbins is the author and illustrator of four inspirational gift books: Wishes for a Young Woman, for a Mid-Aged Woman, for an Old Woman, for Myself; Wishes for a Young Man, for an Old Man, for a Man Who's in the Middle; Wishes for Kids-for the Little Ones, the Big Ones, and All the Ones in Between; and Wishes for the Weary, the Despairing, the Broken-Hearted, and for all Those Who Are Simply Having a Hard Time. As a poet and essayist, Robbins's writing has been published in: the anthologies Sacred Water and At Our Core: Women Writing about Power; the 1997 Poets' Market; and the Writers' Digest website. Inspired by the natural world, especially water, Robbins lives near two small lakes in Cold Spring, Kentucky, a suburb of Cincinnati, Ohio.
